thread.title: North Korean foreign minister to visit Sweden on Thursday

title: North Korean foreign minister to visit Sweden on Thursday
text: March 15, 2018 / 8:34 AM / Updated an hour ago North Korean foreign minister to visit Sweden on Thursday Reuters Staff 2 Min Read STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - North Korean Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho will begin a rare two-day visit on Thursday to Sweden, which represents the United States diplomatically in the isolated country, the Swedish Foreign Ministry said. North Korean Foreign Minister Ri Yong-ho walks to speak to the media outside the Millennium hotel New York, U.S., September 25, 2017. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton/Files Sweden, which is not a member of the U.S.-led NATO military alliance, has been mentioned as a possible location for a mooted face-to-face meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. Ri will hold talks with his Swedish counterpart Margot Wallstrom on the security situation on the Korean peninsula and Sweden’s representation of the United States, which has no embassy in North Korea, the ministry said. In its statement, it noted that the U.N. Security Council had unanimously condemned North Korea’s nuclear weapons and missile programmes and demanded the “complete, verifiable and irrevocable elimination of these programmes”. “Sweden fully supports the Security Council resolutions. The aim of the visit is to contribute to the effective implementation of the resolutions,” the ministry said. Since Trump’s surprise announcement last week that he was willing to meet North Korea’s Kim, speculation has mounted over what location might be chosen to host what would be the first-ever meeting between serving leaders of the two countries. Kim has yet to publicly confirm his readiness to meet Trump. Reporting by Niklas Pollard, Johan Sennero and Daniel Dickson; Editing by Gareth Jones
